alert.note: Alert for Accomack (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Watch issued January 15 at 9:12PM EST until January 17 at 3:00PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM SUNDAY TO 10 AM EST MONDAY... ...COASTAL FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY EVENING THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 8 to 12 feet expected in the surf zone. For the Coastal Flood Watch, two feet of inundation above ground level possible in low- lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. * WHERE...Bayside of Accomack County for the Coastal Flood Watch, Atlantic side of Accomack County for the High Surf Advisory. * WHEN...For the High Surf Advisory, from 7 PM Sunday to 10 AM EST Monday. For the Coastal Flood Watch, from Sunday evening through Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Some roads may be closed. Low lying property including homes, businesses, and some critical infrastructure may be inundated. Some shoreline erosion may occur. Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions.
